scikit-bio: Open Source Foundation

Our platform is built on scikit-bio, a DOE-funded open-source bioinformatics library trusted by researchers worldwide.

  • Global adoption: Used by leading research institutions
  • Peer-reviewed: Published in Nature journals
Visit scikit-bio →

Active Research Collaborations

National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

Multi-year collaboration developing microbiome-based biomarkers for infectious disease susceptibility and treatment response prediction.

NYU Langone Health

Joint research on multi-omics integration for cancer immunotherapy response prediction and patient stratification in oncology trials.

University of Calgary

Collaborative studies on microbiome-metabolome interactions in autoimmune diseases and therapeutic intervention optimization.
